1.question: One of the businesses owned by Kirsten Blowers, the entrepreneur profiled in the opening feature of Chapter 1, is Riffraff. Riffraff sells ________.

options.C: jewelry

2.question: Which of the following is an accurate characterization of interest in entrepreneurship?

options.A: There is minimal interest in entrepreneurship across the world.
options.B: There is minimal interest in entrepreneurship in North America and Europe, but significant interest in Asia and Australia.
options.C: There is significant interest in entrepreneurship in North America and Europe, but minimal interest in Asia and Australia.
options.D: While interest in entrepreneurship was once high, it is waning in popularity across the world.
options.E: There is tremendous interest in entrepreneurship across the world.

3.question: According to the Global Entrepreneurship Monitor (GEM) 2015-2016 survey, about ________ percent of adults in the United States are either starting a business or are running a business that has been in existence for less than 3 1/2 years.

4.question: According to the Global Entrepreneurship Monitor (GEM) 2015-2016 study, the majority of people in high-income countries are drawn to entrepreneurship ________.

options.A: to take advantage of an attractive opportunity
options.B: due to lack of career prospects
options.C: as a result of government incentives
options.D: because an important role model was an entrepreneur

5.question: Which of the following statements regarding survival rates of entrepreneurial firms in the United States is correct?

options.A: As high as 50 percent after four years
options.B: As high as 60 percent after four years
options.C: As high as 70 percent after four years
options.D: As high as 80 percent after four years
options.E: As high as 90 percent after four years

6.question: Cody Rodgers is the founder of a company named Extreme Sports Apparel. The company makes apparel products for extreme sports enthusiasts such as rock climbers, triathletes, skateboarders, and BMX bikers. Cody wants his company to pursue a high level of corporate entrepreneurship. To achieve that goal, Cody's firm should be ________.

options.A: innovative, risk averse, and take a "wait and see" posture
options.B: taking a "wait and see" posture, innovative, and risk taking
options.C: proactive, not innovative, and risk taking
options.D: taking a "wait and see" posture, not innovative, and risk averse

7.question: Google is a firm that is proactive, innovative and risk-taking. From this description, we can most accurately conclude that Google has a high level of ________.

options.C: entrepreneurial intensity

8.question: Apple is an established firm that encourages and emphasizes entrepreneurial behavior throughout its various divisions. According to the textbook, Apple practices ________ entrepreneurship.

options.C: strategic

9.question: According to the opening feature on Kirsten Blowers, Riffraff's early success was adversely affected by the actions of Pinterest.

10.question: According to the results of the GEM 2015-2016 survey, about 1 out of every 8 and a ½ American adults is actively engaged in starting a business or is the owner/manager of a business that is less than 3 ½ years old.

11.question: According to reliable statistics, 9 out of 10 businesses fail in their first few years of existence.

12.question: Entrepreneurship is the process by which individuals pursue opportunities within the constraints of the resources they control.

13.question: Established firms with an entrepreneurial emphasis are proactive, innovative, and risk-taking.

16.question: The three primary reasons that people become entrepreneurs and start their own firms are to ________.

options.A: gain prestige, realize financial rewards, and eliminate risk in their lives
options.B: do what they were "born" to do, be their own boss, and gain prestige
options.C: take big risks, be their own boss, and do what they were "born" to do
options.D: be their own boss, pursue their own ideas, and pursue financial rewards
options.E: take advantage of government subsidies, pursue their own ideas, and realize financial rewards

17.question: According to the textbook, the number one reason that people become entrepreneurs is to ________.

options.C: be their own boss

18.question: Kasey Stevenson is starting a firm in the women's clothing industry primarily to pursue financial rewards. According to the textbook, starting a business to make a lot of money ________.

options.A: often fails to live up to its hype
options.B: is equally as satisfying as other reasons for starting a business
options.C: is the number one reason people start their own business
options.D: is the number two reason that people start their own business, right behind the lack of better career prospects
options.E: does not rank among the top three reasons that people start their own business

19.question: The number one reason that people become entrepreneurs is to pursue financial rewards.

20.question: According to the textbook, the four characteristics of successful entrepreneurs are ________.

options.A: passion for the business, on the cutting edge of technological change, very charismatic, and tenacity despite failure
options.B: young and energetic, passion for the business, product/customer focus, and seeks recognition
options.C: passion for the business, tenacity despite failure, product/customer focus, and execution
options.D: on the cutting edge of technological change, forward thinking, tenacity despite failure, and intelligence
options.E: passion for the business, seeks recognition, young and energetic, and execution intelligence

21.question: The number one characteristic shared by successful entrepreneurs is ________.

options.A: a desire to achieve financial rewards
options.C: a desire to employ other people
options.D: a desire to fulfill a lifetime dream
options.E: a desire to bring a revolutionary new product or service to market

22.question: According to the textbook, the passion that motivates people to launch entrepreneurial firms typically stems from the entrepreneur's belief that the business will ________.

options.C: increase his or her prestige
options.D: lead to a high-level job in the corporate sector

23.question: Which of the following was NOT identified in the textbook as one of the five primary reasons passion is important for the launch of a successful entrepreneurial organization?

options.A: The ability to stick to a plan even when faced with evidence that changes are needed
options.B: A willingness to work hard for an extended period of time
options.C: The ability to overcome setbacks and "no's"
options.D: The ability to listen to feedback on the limitations of your organization and yourself
options.E: Perseverance and persistence when the going gets tough

24.question: The What Went Wrong? feature in Chapter 1 focuses on Prim, a failed startup in the laundry industry. According to the feature, Prim failed largely as a result of ________.

options.C: the individuals who started the firm were too young and inexperienced
options.E: a lack of passion and resolve

25.question: Stacey Wills, who is at heart a craftsperson, recently started a firm to manufacture a new innovative food blender. Stacey's desire is to sell her food blender to as many people as possible because she firmly believes in the merits of her product. Stacey's story best illustrates which of the following characteristics, or attributes, of a successful entrepreneur?

options.C: Tenacity despite failure
options.E: A desire to gain financial rewards

26.question: Alex and Patty Webb launched a firm several years ago and have been particularly successful in introducing new products to the marketplace. One thing that Alex and Patty are particularly good at is translating their thoughts, creativity, and imaginations into products that reach the marketplace. The ability to make this happen is most closely related to which of the following characteristics of successful entrepreneurs?

options.C: Tenacity despite failure

27.question: The Savvy Entrepreneurial Firm feature in Chapter 1 focuses on incubators and accelerators, those that help start-ups. ________ are organizations that offer a small amount of seed funding in exchange for small equity positions in the companies that participate in their programs.

options.C: Accelerators

28.question: The number one characteristic shared by successful entrepreneurs is passion for the business.

29.question: The four main characteristics of successful entrepreneurs are: passion for the business, execution intelligence, product/customer focus, and tenacity despite failure.

30.question: The passion that entrepreneurs have typically stems from the ability to pursue their own ideas.

32.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the five common myths about entrepreneurs?

options.C: Entrepreneurs should be young and energetic.

33.question: According to the textbook, entrepreneurs are ________.

options.C: aggressive risk takers

34.question: Which of the following was NOT identified in the textbook as one of the common traits and characteristics of entrepreneurs?

options.C: Tolerant of ambiguity

35.question: Suppose you are a Small Business Development Center counselor and you're looking at the personality profiles of five potential entrepreneurs. Based on the profiles, which individual has the most desirable mix of personal characteristics to become a successful entrepreneur?

options.A: Candidate A: visionary, energetic, moderate risk taker
options.B: Candidate B: seeks recognition, self-starter, creative
options.C: Candidate C: visionary, high-risk taker, energetic
options.D: Candidate D: high-risk taker, achievement-motivated, networker
options.E: Candidate E: tolerant for ambiguity, seeks recognition, motivated primarily by money

36.question: Which of the following is NOT a personality trait or characteristic common among entrepreneurs?

options.C: Short attention span

37.question: Which of the following statements is correct regarding entrepreneurial activity and age ranges?

options.A: The highest percentage of entrepreneurs falls in the 20 to 34 age range.
options.B: The highest percentage of entrepreneurs falls in the 45 to 54 age range.
options.C: The highest percentage of entrepreneurs falls in the 35 to 44 age range.
options.D: The highest percentage of entrepreneurs falls in the 55 to 64 age range.
options.E: The highest percentage of entrepreneurs falls in the 60 + age range.

38.question: Which of the following statements is incorrect regarding entrepreneurial activity and age range?

options.A: The highest percent of business owners fall in the 45-54 age range.
options.B: The lowest percent of business owners fall in the 60 + age range.
options.C: The majority of business founders have no prior work experience.
options.D: The majority of individuals who start companies are in their forties and fifties.
options.E: Entrepreneurial activity is fairly evenly spread out over age ranges.

39.question: According to Chapter 1, investors often cite the ________ as their most important criterion in the decision to fund new ventures.

options.A: financial position of the new venture
options.B: strength of the industry the new firm is entering
options.C: strength of the new venture's marketing plan

40.question: According to Chapter 1, a sentiment that venture capitalists often express is that ________.

options.A: the strength of the entrepreneur and the strength of the business idea are of equal importance
options.B: they would never fund a strong entrepreneur with a weak business idea
options.C: they would rather fund a strong entrepreneur with a mediocre business idea than fund a strong business idea with a mediocre entrepreneur
options.D: a new venture's marketing plan is more important than either the strength of the entrepreneur or the strength of the business idea
options.E: they would rather fund a strong business idea with a mediocre entrepreneur than fund a strong entrepreneur with a mediocre business idea

41.question: Pacific Fishing LLC is a startup that is working on a new technology for the fishing industry. Because the technology it's working on is highly proprietary, the company is located in the warehouse district of a large western city. Pacific's founder, Ray Sims, rarely gives interviews and is careful to not divulge much about what the company is doing. Which of the following common myths about entrepreneurs does the behavior of its founder, Ray Sims, dispel?

options.C: Entrepreneurs are motivated primarily by money.
options.D: Entrepreneurs should be young and energetic.

42.question: According to the consensus of the research, some people are genetically predisposed to be entrepreneurs.

43.question: Entrepreneurs are usually moderate, rather than high, risk-takers.

44.question: Entrepreneurs are motivated primarily by money.

45.question: According to the textbook, there are three types of startup firms: ________.

options.A: lifestyle firms, general firms, and entrepreneurial firms
options.B: standard-of-living firms, statutory firms, and general firms
options.C: entrepreneurial firms, standard-of-living firms, and statutory firms
options.D: lifestyle firms, salary-substitute firms, and entrepreneurial firms
options.E: innovative firms, entrepreneurial firms, and standard firms

46.question: Colorado Sandwich, Soup and Salad is a casual dining restaurant that has been owned by Stephanie Peterson for the past 14 years. The restaurant offers a menu that is typical for casual dining restaurants and affords Stephanie a level of income that is similar to what she would earn in a conventional job. According to the textbook, Colorado Sandwich, Soup and Salad is an example of a(n) ________ firm.

options.C: quality-of-life

47.question: Montana Sky Trails leads multiday outdoor adventure trips for private groups and corporate clients to various locations across Montana. The company was started by Justin Smith, an individual that gave up a prestigious job in banking because Montana Sky Trails better accommodates his personal lifestyle. Montana Sky Trails is an example of a(n) ________ firm.

options.C: standard-of-living

options.A: are small firms that yield a level of income for their owner(s) that is similar to what they would earn when working for an employer
options.B: bring to market new products and services that are not particularly innovative
options.C: offer to customers common products that are not particularly innovative, and provide their owner(s) the opportunity to pursue a particular lifestyle and earn a living while doing so
options.D: provide their owner(s) the opportunity to pursue a particular lifestyle and earn a living while doing so
options.E: bring new products and services to market by creating and seizing opportunities

49.question: According to the textbook, Dropbox, Facebook, and Uber are examples of ________ firms.

options.C: industry-standard

50.question: The Partnering for Success feature in Chapter 1 focuses on campus ambassador or campus rep programs. According to the feature, which of the following is NOT a characteristic that such programs typically look for in student hires?

options.C: Have a wide network of friends
options.E: Have in-depth knowledge and love for the product

51.question: In terms of the "types" of startup firms, entrepreneurial firms bring new products and services to market.

53.question: Which of the following statements is NOT true about women-owned businesses in the United States?

options.A: The number of women-owned businesses is decreasing.
options.B: A total of 44 percent of women-owned businesses are owned by minorities.
options.C: In some industries, women own a significant share of the business.
options.D: The number of groups that support and advocate for women-owned businesses continues to increase.
options.E: Over the past nine years, the number of women-owned businesses has grown at a rate five times faster than the national average.

54.question: There has been ________ in the number of minority entrepreneurs in the United States over the past several years.

options.C: no meaningful change

55.question: Which of the following was NOT given in the textbook as a reason for the increase in the number of senior entrepreneurs?

options.A: Seniors tend to be more passionate about new business ideas than middle-aged or younger prospective entrepreneurs.
options.B: Many seniors have extensive business experience and other qualities that equip them for an entrepreneurial career.
options.C: Growing worries among seniors that they need to earn additional income to pay for future health care services and other expenses
options.D: An increasing desire among older workers for more personal fulfillment in their lives.

56.question: According to a Bentley University survey, ________ percent of millennials have a desire to start their own business.

57.question: Over the past 10 years, the demographic makeup of entrepreneurial firms has remained fairly stable in the United States and around the world.

58.question: Although interest in entrepreneurship remains high nationwide, the number of women-owned businesses is decreasing.

59.question: Unfortunately, statistics show that there is very little interest in entrepreneurship among young people in the United States.

60.question: As new products that are better than the existing generation of products are introduced, sales normally increase because the new products provide consumers increased value or worth. This process, which is called ________, stimulates economic activity, which is a good thing for the economy.

options.C: iterative replacement

61.question: In the book The Theory of Economic Development, ________ argued that entrepreneurs develop new products and technologies that, over time, make current products and technologies obsolete. This process is called creative destruction.

options.C: Joseph Schumpeter

62.question: According to the textbook, entrepreneurship has historically had ________.

options.A: a major impact on the economy and minor impact on society
options.B: a minor impact on both the economy and society
options.C: a major impact on society and minor impact on the economy
options.D: a major impact on both the economy and society
options.E: no impact on either the economy or society

63.question: ________ is the process of creating something new, which is central to the entrepreneurial process.

options.C: Execution

64.question: In regard to patent activity (issuance), which of the following statements is correct?

options.A: Small businesses outperform their larger counterparts.
options.B: Small businesses underperform their larger counterparts.
options.C: Small businesses and large businesses are relatively equal.
options.D: Small businesses are not active in patent activity.
options.E: Large businesses are not active in patent activity.

65.question: Joseph Schumpeter argued that entrepreneurs develop new products and technologies that over time make current products and technologies obsolete, and this process, which he called creative destruction, is good because it stimulates economic activity.

66.question: Innovation is the process of creating something new, which is central to the entrepreneurial process.

67.question: Small businesses outperform their larger counterparts in terms of patent activity (issuance).

69.question: Which of the following is the correct sequence for the four steps in the entrepreneurial process?

options.A: Deciding to become an entrepreneur, developing successful business ideas, moving from an idea to an entrepreneurial firm
options.B: Developing successful business ideas, deciding to become an entrepreneur, moving from an idea to an entrepreneurial firm
options.C: Developing successful business ideas, moving from an idea to an entrepreneurial firm, managing and growing the entrepreneurial firm
options.D: Deciding to become an entrepreneur, moving from an idea to an entrepreneurial firm, managing and growing the entrepreneurial firm
options.E: Managing and growing the entrepreneurial firm, developing successful business ideas, deciding to become an entrepreneur, moving from an idea to an entrepreneurial firm

70.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the four steps of the entrepreneurial process?

options.B: Determining how to seize the spotlight
options.C: Developing successful business ideas
options.D: Moving from an idea to an entrepreneurial firm
options.E: Managing and growing the entrepreneurial firm

71.question: An event that prompts an individual to become an entrepreneur, such as losing a job, inheriting money, or accommodating a certain lifestyle, is referred to as a(n) ________.

options.C: initiating event

72.question: Jan Berry recently received a $500,000 inheritance from her maternal grandmother. Jan decided to use the money to start a business. According to the textbook, the inheritance that Jan received was the ________ that prompted her to start a business.

options.C: initiating event

73.question: A(n) ________ is a written document that describes all the aspects of a business venture in a concise manner.

options.C: operations plan

74.question: A firm's ________ is a plan for how it competes, uses its resources, structures its relationships, interfaces with customers, and creates value to sustain itself on the basis of the value it creates.

options.C: tactical model
